ETYMOLOGY: From Medieval Latin assassinare, from Arabic hashshāshīn (referring to a secret order of Nizari Ismailis in Syria led by Hasan-i Sabbah, reputed to murder opposing leaders, often under the influence of hashish). The word passed through Italian and French before entering English.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The murder of a prominent person, especially for political or religious reasons.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 出于政治或宗教原因，对知名人物进行的谋杀。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The assassination of the archduke triggered a series of events leading to war.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 大公遇刺引发了一系列导致战争的事件。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: character assassination [of sb] / an assassination [of sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A malicious attack on someone's good character or reputation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某人良好品格或声誉的恶意攻击；中伤。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The politician accused his rivals of engaging in character assassination.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位政治家指责他的对手进行人格中伤。
